column5: Yesterday we lost another of our good neighbors to the north, Farley Mowat. Author, environmentalist, outspoken advocate for a variety of good causes, he will be missed. If you aren't familiar with his many books, look for some at your local library or download a few to your Kindle.http://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-27319545

an excellent writer - I read "People of the Deer" years ago and it totally changed my view of native peoples. I'll have to get some of his other books in remembrance. "conquered peoples never forget - no matter how much their conquerors want them to." thanks, phish
I believe I took " A Farley Mowat Reader" with me on one of my first solo trips. May he rest with Stompin' Tom......
For those with young teenagers who spend too much time on videogames, buy a copy of Lost in the Barrens.
Enjoyed reading his writings. He had a great grasp on natures wonder and the enjoyment we all get from it. He will be missed. May He Rest In Peace Mike Kansas
Farley delivered one of my favorite quotes..."never let the facts get in the way of the truth"
That's a shame. He was an interesting person and a good writer. Thanks for posting.
